intro: Casearia rovumensis, commonly known as the Rovuma casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
